column4: Hey, I only have one screen resolution to pick from which is only 800 * 600 how do i fix this/
Hey, I only have one screen resolution to pick from which is only 800 * 600 how do i fix this/
did you try that link?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org  pastebin your xorg.conf file
does "sudo ddcprobe | grep monitorrange" return anything?
install xresprobe, then re-run
yep
it returned nothing
ok, my stab is that your monitor's rates are wrong.  you can't autodetect via that command.  what monitor do you have?
can you find a specific model number on it?
it says trinitron in the top right corner.
ultraScan p780
that should be it. one sec
certain it's 19 inch?
any news?
i was trying to look up your monitor specs, but i can only see the p780 in 17-inch form: http://support.ap.dell.com/support/systemsinfo/documentation.aspx?c=au&l=en&s=gen&~cat=3&~subcat=49
do you think that the monitor really has that much effect on it?
well i've seen incorrect specs affect resolution before
dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg that fixes the screen size but then the card doesnt really work for 3d stuff
yeah, i don't have an nvidia card, so can't really troubleshoot that, sorry.
thanks for your help : P
